programme.title: The Cinema List: Sky Original Thrillers
programme.desc: Love a thriller, but unsure what you want to watch next? Then join us for this fast-paced rundown of the best Sky Original thrillers, from The Desperate Hour to The Independent and beyond.

programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Eleanor is a talented but troubled young rookie detective wrestling with the demons of her past, when she is called to the scene of a brutal mass shooting - the work of a new and terrifying murderer. The police and FBI launch a nationwide manhunt, but are thwarted at every turn by the killer's enigmatic, and unprecedented behaviour. Despite her lack of experience, Eleanor is drawn deeper into the case as she, and her newfound mentor, realise that she may be the only person, given her own tortured psyche, who can understand the mind of this singular killer. programme.desc: A 1999 love story about Deepak (Sanjay Kapoor) and Aarti (Priya Gill) who fall in love without seeing each other. Neha (Sushmita Sen) who also loves Deepak provides the third angle.

programme.title: Thalaivi
programme.desc: A biopic on the late Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa.

programme.title: Kedarnath
programme.desc: (Movie @6) Sara Ali Khan won the 'Best Debut Actress' award at the Awards of the International Indian Film Academy 2019, Filmfare Awards 2019 & Screen Awards in 2020.

programme.title: Coolie No. 1
programme.desc: To avenge his insult, Jai Kishen marries Rozario's daughter to Raju, a porter posing as a millionaire. Chaos ensues when Raju conjures a twin brother to support his lies.

programme.title: Khoon Bhari Mang
programme.desc: Rekha won the 'Best Actress' award, Sonu Walia won the 'Best Supporting Actress award and Sanjay Verma won the 'Best Editor' award at the Filmfare Awards 1989.

programme.title: Khoon Bhari Mang
programme.desc: Rekha won the 'Best Actress' award, Sonu Walia won the 'Best Supporting Actress award and Sanjay Verma won the 'Best Editor' award at the Filmfare Awards 1989.

programme.title: Pure Bollywood
programme.desc: Some of the best soundtracks of Bollywood uncut.

programme.title: Mere Pyaare Prime Minister
programme.desc: This movie won Best International Film award in Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror Films, USA.

programme.title: Satyagraha
programme.desc: A corporate go-getter sees his priorities shift when a personal tragedy brings him face to face with political corruption. Starring Kareena Kapoor, Amitabh Bachchan and Ajay Devgn.

programme.title: Krantiveer
programme.desc: Nana Patekar won 'Best Actor' award, Dimple Kapadia won 'Best Supporting Actress' and K. K. Singh won 'Best Dialogue' award at the Filmfare Awards 1995.

programme.title: Upkar
programme.desc: 1967 cult classic highlighting the contrast between Indian and Western values in the newly independent state. Stars Manoj Kumar and Asha Parekh.

programme.title: Desh Premee
programme.desc: (1982) Patriot Dinanath is tragically separated from his wife and daughter. His son Raju is into illegal activities. Will Dinanath find out that his son is not what he thinks he is?

programme.title: Army
programme.desc: (Movie @6) A 1994 film about Geeta (Sridevi) who, with a group of young lads, seeks revenge from the dreaded gangster Nagraj (Danny Denzongpa) for killing her husband Arjun (Shahrukh Khan).

programme.title: Satyameva Jayate
programme.desc: This movie praised with many awards like Best Debut - Female, Best Performance by an Actor in a Negative Role, New Musical Sensation - Male, Best Cinematographer.

programme.title: Ram Lakhan
programme.desc: Rakhee Gulzar won 'Best Supporting Actress' award, Anupam Kher and Sathish Kaushik won 'Best Comic Actor' award at the Filmfare Awards 1990.

programme.title: Pure Bollywood
programme.desc: Some of the best soundtracks of Bollywood uncut.

programme.title: Baazi
programme.desc: A tough and honest police officer wages a one-man war against terrorists and a corrupt politician who have planned to assassinate the chief minister of the state.

programme.title: Mera Gaon Mera Desh
programme.desc: (1971) An ex-convict comes to a village and decides to take on a dreaded bandit who has terrorised the region.

programme.title: Tiranga
programme.desc: (1992) The story of an army officer and a cop who come together to foil the evil designs of some traitors and uphold the glory and splendour of their motherland. Stars Nana Patekar.

programme.title: Karma
programme.desc: (1986) Subhash Ghai directs this saga of revenge by Dada Thakur (Dilip Kumar) on Dr. Dang (Anupam Kher) as he recruits three deadly prisoners Khairuddun, Baiju and Johnny for his mission.

programme.title: Rashtra Kavach OM
programme.desc: (Movie @6) After losing his memory while fighting enemies, Om has to battle terrorists and amnesia in order to restore his father's honour after his old man was arrested for betraying his country.

programme.title: Attack
programme.desc: A terrorist attack renders Arjun paralysed and distraught with the thoughts of his dead lover. So, when the attacker returns, Arjun participates in an experiment to seek revenge.

programme.title: Commando A One-Man Army
programme.desc: (2013) Karan Dogra, an Indian commando, termed him as a terrorist as he lands into another country. He manages to escape and bumps in Simrit who is in trouble.

programme.title: Aparichit
programme.desc: Story of a man who is a meek lawyer by the day and an undertaker by night, who goes all out against the bad elements of the society with his gruesome murders.

programme.title: Lakshya
programme.desc: This movie was so famous for its songs and choreography and it also won many awards inc. Best Cinematographer, Best Choreography.

programme.title: Purab Aur Paschim
programme.desc: (1970) Bharat (Manoj Kumar) goes to Britain to study. He is shocked to find that the Indians there, shun India and Indians. He takes it upon himself to teach them Indian values.

programme.title: Pardes
programme.desc: Alka Yagnik won the 'Best Singer - Female' award, Mahima Chaudhry won the 'Best Debut Actress award and Subhash Ghai won the 'Best Screenplay' at the Filmfare Awards 1998.

programme.title: Raazi
programme.desc: The film was priased and won several awards including, 'Best Actress, Best Playback Singer - Male, Best Playback Singer - Female, Best Lyrics, Best Film'.

programme.title: Gadar 2
programme.desc: (Movie @6) Tara Singh goes missing during a skirmish and is believed to be captured in Pakistan, his son Jeete sets out to rescue him and enters a labyrinth from which they both must escape.

programme.title: Parmanu: The Story Of Pokhran
programme.desc: (2018) A look at India's second confidential nuclear test series at Pokhran led by Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, during the time of PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee's tenure.

programme.title: Phone Bhoot
programme.desc: A ghost reaches out to two bumbling ghostbusters for a business idea. However, their plans go downhill as the eerie ghost reveals her plan.

programme.title: Pure Bollywood
programme.desc: Some of the best soundtracks of Bollywood uncut.

programme.title: Tumbbad
programme.desc: The film was praised globally and won several awards like best cinematographer, best production designer, best special effects, best film, and best feature film.

programme.title: Ek Aur Ek Gyarah
programme.desc: Govinda and Sanjay Dutt play 2 petty thieves, who are forced by gangsters to kidnap a child in return for their mother. Will they risk the child's life for selfish reasons?

programme.title: Ravanasura
programme.desc: Ravindra, An inept junior lawyer at a law firm, agrees to help a business magnate clear her father's name of murder. However, when bodies start piling up, Ravindra begins to show his true colours.

programme.title: Mehboob Ki Mehandi
programme.desc: Shabana is employed by Yusuf, a rich man, to teach his nephew. Eventually, Yusuf and Shabana fall in love and plan to get married. But the girl has a troubled past that may destroy her future.

programme.title: Kites
programme.desc: Ayananka Bose won an award for the 'Best Cinematography' at the Zee Cine Awards 2011.

programme.title: Agent Vinod
programme.desc: (2012) The saga of love, deceit and danger as an Indian spy, Vinod (Saif Ali Khan), travels worldwide to unravel a conspiracy. Kareena plays his lady love. A film by Sriram Raghavan.

programme.title: Jawani Jaaneman
programme.sub-title: (2020) (Movie @6) A 40-year-old playboy's life turns upside down when he comes to know that he has a 20 something year-o
programme.desc: Saif Ali Khan, Alaya Furniturewala and Tabu.

programme.title: Chinese F1 GP Highlights

programme.desc: Steve Jones, Billy Monger and Lawrence Barretto present the highlights of the Japanese Grand Prix. Max Verstappen and Lewis Hamilton will want to put their DNFs in Melbourne behind them and get back to winning ways. But the prancing horses of Carlos Sainz and Charles Leclerc could make it harder for them to reach the podium.
